questions.question: My son loves ………………………………
questions.description: We do not normally use the article the with plural and uncountable nouns when we are talking about people or things in general.

questions.question: My sister is ……………………………..
questions.description: The article a/an is used for classifying people or things.

questions.question: Please don’t use your nail as …………………………….. screwdriver.
questions.description: The article a/an is used for classifying people or things.

questions.question: Can you recommend …………………………… good dentist?
questions.description: The article a/an is often used with a similar meaning to one.

questions.question: …………………………… must have patience.
questions.description: The article a/an can be used with the same meaning as any.

questions.question: ……………………………… usually start talking at around 18 months old.
questions.description: No article is usually used with plural nouns when we are talking about people or things in general.

questions.question: Did you lock ………………………………door?
questions.description: The article the is used here because the listener knows which door is meant.

questions.question: We hired ………………………………… to go to Mangalore.
questions.description: The article a is used here because the listener does not know which taxi is meant.

questions.question: What did you do with ………………………………. vacuum cleaner I lent you?
questions.description: The article the is used here because the listener knows which vacuum cleaner is meant.

questions.question: Did you enjoy ……………………………….?
questions.description: The article the is used here because the listener knows which party is meant.

questions.question: I am ………………………………. youngest in my family.
questions.description: The article the is used before superlative adjectives.

questions.question: We went to ……………………………… school.
questions.description: We usually use the article the with same.
